data.title: Glenwood Stud
data.meta_description: Wise Guy R, Top Show Jumping lines, stallion standing at Glenwood Stud International, Market Weighton, York
data.text:
Wise Guy R has progeny competing in Show Jumping, Eventing and Dressage, a true Sire of competition horses of all disciplines. Two of his youngsters are now show jumping in Germany and are doing exceptionally well.

​

Wise Guy R now has youngsters doing well and gaining 1st and 2nd Premiums in the BEF Futurity

Scheme. One of his offspring gained a 2nd Premium for eventing at the BEF Futurity and then as a 2

year old gained a 2nd Premium for Eventing. Also, a yearling Valentino Virtuoso R who gained a 1st

Premium and also Lowlands Wise Choice who gained a 1st Premium.

​

One to watch for the future is Barbara Anderson's Diego, who competed at Arena UK.They had a

very successful day with two out of three double clears and a placing.In september 2021, Diego was

8th out of 70 starters at Arena UK.

​

Elaine Cudhay and Lowlands Wise Choice have Qualified for an assessment for the Equine

Pathway introduced by the World Class Programme. The purpose is to identify horses that have the

potential to develop into medal winning horses.

​

Vanessa Wark took her young 4 year old mare Promise by Wise Guy R to the BBDRC Camp at Park

End. She said “my smile says it all of how proud I am of Promise...she was fantastic & literally took to

her first ever time cross country like a duck to water!! Exciting times ahead!!”.

Vanessa Wark and Promise went for there first trip to Bobbis Camp at Somerford.

Vanessa described their day as riding in every season throughout the day including

snow, which she wished would have stayed away! Vanessa describes Promise as

"brilliant! Her temperament is amazing; she takes everything in her stride, and a

pleasure to do anything with. So looking forward to see what the future brings for her!".

​

Zutopia Advanced Event mare by Wise Guy R x Cavanta was conceived with

Embryo Transfer, she has since been placed 1st Foxhunter and XC Bicton Novice

double clear. At the Cornbury Horse Trials September 2021, Zutopia went double

clear in the CCI3*.

Homebred Ghillie Go Lightly by Wise Guy R owned by Claire McNay are the

Individual Accumlator leaders in the first of five rounds in this seasons Arena Eventing

Series, which attracted riders from across the region to compete. They also took 1st

placed in the most competitive class of the day, the 90cm Speed and Joker class.

They also won the Cumbria Horse Trials Arena Eventing Individual Accumulator!

​

Claire McNay & Ghillie Go Lightly finished Eglinton Horse Trials, Barskimming in 6th

place on their dressage score of 32.3 with their second double clear at BE90.

Owner Claire and Ghillie started the year with two 1st place rosettes at Blackdyke Farm

showjumping. Claire described it as a "fab way to end my holidays, showjumping at

Blackdyke Farm with 2 red ones for Ghillie boy! The 95 jump off was may favourite bit

then our luck ran out in the 105 but fair to say he's enjoying his jumping right now".

​

The Hartpury Showjumping Spectacular ran from 18th -21st July 2019, where 4 year old Wiseland owned by Paul Connor competed. Wiseland was ridden by Milli Cornock on Day 3 & jumped a fantastic round with an unfortunate pole down. The 4 year old jumped again the following day, and was described as the "star of the day by Milli". Wiseland jumped a great double clear for 8th, by far his biggest track!

​

Crimson Sky owned by Trish Thomas, ridden by Paddy Muir, has been successfully competing at showjumping. They were placed 2nd Discovery, DC 1.05m at Northallerton in 2020, Area 12A Newcomer 3rd place in the Second Round - fabulous clear round and has Qualified for Aintree!

​

Landgraf top breeding stallion has produced over 50 approved stallions and over 70 state premium mares just in Germany and heads the German yearbook with the total winnings of his progeny over 6 million D-Marks. Landgraf is in the bloodlines of the famous Ladykiller who sired 33 approved stallions and dominates Holsteiner pedigrees to such an extent that those without his name are becoming rare.

​

Concorde International Showjumper (Jos Lansink) and winner of many Grand Prix. The last three years he was the sire with the most offspring at the World Breeding Championships for young horses, and has proved himself to be an absolute top sire of International Sporthorses. Some of his offspring have proved themselves to be at the very top at Grand Prix level and World Cup Jumping. In the Grand Prix at Rotterdam 3 from the top 8 were his offspring.

He was elected Horse of the Year in 2004 and is the highest ranked KWPN stallion in the top ten of the WBFSH.

​

Miance RV is a full sister of the approved stallion Newton who has three sons approved, also on his dams side is Ladykiller xx sire of Fiance who is a full sister of the Holstein approved Hallmark, sire “lord” (9 approved sons and 143 approved daughters) and also grand dam of stallion Carbano and KWPN stallion Emilion who has two approved sons and has proven to belong to the worlds best producer of showjumpers.

​

Voltaire International Showjumper and winner of many Grand Prix. Voltaire was the sire with the most offspring at the Atlanta Olympics in 1991. and is second on the World Breeding Ranking of Showjumping Sires. He is the sire of 50 approved sons, and many of his offspring jump at Grand Prix level and compete in the international dressage ring. Voltaire has been awarded ‘Huntersire of the Year 2001, 2002, 2003, and at the moment is one of the top sires of KWPN Jumping Index with 151 points.

​

​
